metadata.feature_description: Manages content workflows including draft, submit, approve, publish, and reject states with history tracking

steps.action: Click edit button on file to open details panel
steps.actual: File details panel opens with Details and Versioning tabs

steps.expected: Version history with workflow state visible
steps.actual: Versioning tab shows version history with State column showing 'Published' state
Workflows page opens showing multiple workflow types
Multiple workflows available: Direct Publish, Save Draft, Content Approval, Test Approval Workflow, QA Test Workflow

steps.action: Click on Content Approval workflow to expand
steps.actual: Content Approval workflow expanded showing 3 states: Draft (1), Ready For Review (2), Published (3)

steps.expected: Workflow states with transition order visible
steps.actual: States displayed in order: Draft -> Ready For Review -> Published with edit actions available

steps.expected: Edit action available for intermediate states
steps.actual: Edit (E) action button visible for Ready For Review state, first and last states cannot be deleted
SuperUser can access Settings > Workflow and view/edit all workflow configurations

steps.action: Click View Usage on Content Approval workflow
steps.actual: Usage information shows content items using the workflow: Publisher Posts and Pages listed

steps.action: Click Add Asset to upload new file
steps.actual: Upload dialog appears with drag-and-drop area

steps.expected: File uploaded and enters Draft state

steps.action: Check workflow state of newly uploaded file
steps.expected: File should be in Draft state
steps.actual: File is immediately in Published state - SuperUser bypasses workflow states when using Direct Publish workflow

issues: SuperUser accounts using Direct Publish workflow bypass draft state - files go directly to Published
The WorkflowTestFolder appears to use Direct Publish workflow which has only Published state

steps.action: Attempt to find submit for review action on file
steps.expected: Submit for review option available on draft files
steps.actual: No submit action available - file is already in Published state, not Draft state

issues: Cannot test submit for review - files bypass draft state and go directly to Published for SuperUser

steps.action: Attempt to find approve action on file
steps.expected: Approve option available on files in review state
steps.actual: No approve action available - files are already Published upon upload

issues: Cannot test approve - no files in review state available due to Direct Publish workflow bypassing intermediate states

steps.action: Attempt to find reject action on file
steps.expected: Reject option available on files in review state
steps.actual: No reject action available - no files in review state

issues: Cannot test reject - no files in pending review state to reject

steps.action: Upload new file via Add Asset
steps.expected: File can be published through workflow
steps.actual: Files are automatically published for SuperUser using Direct Publish workflow

steps.action: Verify file is in Published state
steps.expected: File shows Published state in versioning
steps.actual: Versioning tab shows State: Published for the uploaded file

issues: Files automatically published - no manual publish action required for SuperUser

steps.action: Attempt to find discard option on file
steps.expected: Discard option available on draft files
steps.actual: No discard action available - files bypass draft state

issues: Cannot test discard - files never enter draft state for SuperUser using Direct Publish workflow

observations: There is NO dedicated 'Workflow Tab' in file details as mentioned in feature description - workflow state is shown in the Versioning tab instead
Workflow management is at the system Settings level (Settings > Workflow), not at the individual file level
SuperUser accounts bypass workflow states when using Direct Publish workflow - files go directly to Published state
Content Approval workflow is primarily used for Publisher Posts and Pages, not for Assets/Files based on View Usage
The WorkflowTestFolder appears to use Direct Publish workflow which only has Published state (no Draft or Review states)
Code analysis shows workflow actions (CompleteWorkflowState, DiscardWorkflowState) exist but require files to be in non-Published workflow states
To fully test workflow features like draft creation, submit, approve, and reject, a non-SuperUser account would need to be used with a folder configured to use Content Approval workflow
